{"step_by_step_thinking": "The quadruple test for antenatal detection of Down syndrome includes four markers. According to Document [0], these markers are alpha-fetoprotein (AFP), human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), unconjugated estriol, and inhibin A. Therefore, the marker that is not used in the quadruple test is ss-hCG.", "answer_choice": "B"}
